code_etoe: ((criteria_1 AND criteria_2 AND criteria_3 AND criteria_4 AND criteria_6 AND criteria_7) OR (criteria_1 AND criteria_2 AND criteria_3 AND criteria_5 AND criteria_6 AND criteria_7))

criteria.criteria: An outpatient (not inpatient or in an institutional setting)
Not eligible for Medicare Part D

Prescribed and currently taking a qualified specialty drug within the covered specialty drug categories as identified by the following disease state categories:

a. Diabetes,

b. Asthma/Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Diseases (COPD)

c. Hypertension

d. Cardiovascular diseases

e. Severe mental health disorders

f. HIV/AIDS

g. Hepatitis C (HCV)

h. Cancer

i. Blood Factors or Hemlibra for the treatment of Bleeding disorders

j. Dyslipidemia

k. Bone Disease-Arthritis (such as Osteoporosis, Osteoarthritis, or Rheumatoid Arthritis)

l. Alzheimer’s Disease

m. End-Stage Renal Disease (ESRD)

name: sssssxz

code_etoe: ((criteria_1 AND criteria_2 AND criteria_3 AND criteria_4 AND criteria_6 AND criteria_7) OR (criteria_1 AND criteria_2 AND criteria_3 AND criteria_5 AND criteria_6 AND criteria_7))

criteria.criteria: An outpatient (not inpatient or in an institutional setting)
Not eligible for Medicare Part D

Prescribed and currently taking a qualified specialty drug within the covered specialty drug categories as identified by the following disease state categories:

a. Diabetes,

b. Asthma/Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Diseases (COPD)

c. Hypertension

d. Cardiovascular diseases

e. Severe mental health disorders

f. HIV/AIDS

g. Hepatitis C (HCV)

h. Cancer

i. Blood Factors or Hemlibra for the treatment of Bleeding disorders

j. Dyslipidemia

k. Bone Disease-Arthritis (such as Osteoporosis, Osteoarthritis, or Rheumatoid Arthritis)

l. Alzheimer’s Disease

m. End-Stage Renal Disease (ESRD)

Patient is taking a single medication which Medi-Cal reimbursement
exceeds $75,000 per year.

Patient is taking five or more chronic medications (including prescription
and nonprescription medications, herbal products, and other dietary
supplements)

Patient meets at least one of the following risk of treatment failure criteria:

a. Patient is receiving care from more than one prescriber

b. Patient has laboratory values outside the normal range that could be caused by or may be improved with medication therapy

c. Patient has demonstrated non-adherence (including underuse and overuse) to a medication regimen for more than 3 months

d. Patient has limited health literacy or socio-cultural challenges, requiring special communication strategies to optimize care

e. Patient has recently experienced an adverse event (medication or non-medication-related) while receiving care

f. Patient is taking high-risk medication(s), including narrow therapeutic index drugs (e.g., warfarin, phenytoin, methotrexate, digoxin)

g. Patient has history of E.D. visits/hospitalization related to medication compliance/adherence

h. Patient was recently discharged from a hospital or Skilled Nursing Facility (SNF) within 14 days and prescribed a new medication regimen.

j. Patient was referred to MTM services by a health care provider.

An eligible beneficiary must be agree to participate and can choose to opt
out at any time.

name: Medi-cal MTM
